alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Southampton; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 10:09AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Bertie, eastern Northampton, Hertford, Gates, northwestern Chowan, southeastern Greensville, and southern Southampton Counties, the City of Franklin and the southwestern City of Suffolk through 1100 AM EDT... At 1009 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Como, or 7 miles northeast of Murfreesboro, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Ahoskie, Murfreesboro, Rich Square, Aulander, Boykins, Gatesville, Ryland, Chowan University, Suffolk, Gates, Conway, Woodland, Winton, Cofield, Newsoms, Powellsville, Roxobel, Colerain and Harrellsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
